intro: Stenomesson trichromum, commonly known as the three-colored morning glory, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its strikingly colorful, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically display three distinct colors, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and climbing habit. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and twining. Stenomesson trichromum is cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes grown as a decorative vine in gardens.
